question: Question_02_(a)_iii
sols:
The given problem is equivalent to
$\displaystyle x^{2} \equiv 4 \mod{5}$. Testing all points gives

\begin{align*}
0^{2} &\equiv 0 \mod{5}\\
1^{2} &\equiv 1 \mod{5}\\
2^{2} &\equiv 4 \mod{5}\\
3^{2} &\equiv 4 \mod{5}\\
4^{2} &\equiv 1 \mod{5}
\end{align*}

and so the smallest admissible integer is
$\displaystyle x \equiv 2 \mod{5}$
hints:
This is the same as $\displaystyle x^{2} \equiv 4 \mod{5}$. Try all the
numbers modulo 5 and pick the smallest one.
